Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment”
Reviews.Author: jhun100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July 2012 with my wife and son. The apartment is well maintained, clean, very good furnishings and most of all the bed and linen are very good and comfortable. The only issues we faced is the toilet flush which you need to flush two times get everything down and the other thing is the very strong water pressure in the lavatory which nearly soaked my mobile phone in my waist when I first opened the tap. Location is very good since its very near to the Yau Ma Tei metro station. Like what other people mentioned in their reviews, there are lots of cheap eateries around the apartment but I don't suggest them because most of the food are greasy and heavily soaked in oil. The other thing I did not like is that one week before our stay, I received an email from the Chi management telling us that we were upgraded to another apartment which is Chi 120 in Sheung Wan, Hong Kong island. It felt like they just wanted to move us to one of their apartments to give way to their other customers (maybe for a higher rate). I declined the offer since we have no plans in staying in the Hong Kong side. Overall, a good apartment close to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Pimsiri C
Reviews.Content: The service apartment is fully answer my requirements. Cleaness, modern, comfortable, good location. There are only 12nd floor and 24 rooms which 1 floor per 2 rooms; kicthen, microwave, dish, bowl, pot, pan, iron, bread maker, air purifier, mosquito killer machine, umbrella, shopping bag, etc I am strongly suggest all traveller to stay in this place. You will never feel to go back home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, location, worth the price, kitchen provided”
Reviews.Author: JeanNgYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in CHI Residence 279 with my husband and my 16 months boy from 23-Jun to 26-Jun. CHI 279 is very suitable for a family with a baby/toddler. Apartment is similar to a one room flat in Singapore with everything provided. How to reach CHI 279? Buy MTR ticket from HK Airport to Kowloon MTR. (HK$90 Adult, HK$45 Child). Take free shuttle bus (K1) and alight at Eaton Smart Hotel (6 Stops), walk estimiate 350m to CHI Residence 279. Service: 100% Service Excellent from the Staff. Room is always clean & tidy after we returned back from shopping. Two persons who serve us during the trip are Johnny and Ying. The rest not sure of their name, they just greet us with a smile everyday. Toilet: Big toilet. All toiletries provided, except shaver. Shower hose/tap is using GROHE brand. (Branded). Bedroom: Suitable for 2 adults and baby/toddler. Not suitable for an extra person cos there will not be enough space to put a bed. Even a cot-bed is quite cramp. Our baby sleeps in between us. Bed is very comfortable, my baby can sleep very long. Two big cupboards with hangers and a safe provided. Kitchen: Almost all utensils are provided. All bowls, plates, cups, glasses are made of glass, might not be suitable for children. Microwave, bread toaster. Iron, iron-board, umbrella, room slippers are found in a cupboard. Living room: Smart TV. (Don't have to bring your personal laptop). H-Fi, DVD player. Ionizeer, air-con. Location: 2-3 min walk to Yau Ma Tei MTR. 2 min walk to Tin Hau Temple. 2 min walk to temple street. You can purchase Mango Dessert everyday from the same building, level 1. Opposite the street are the hawker stalls. Others: Dryers x02 and washing machine x02 provided on rooftop. Price: Worth the price. Comparable to a 4 star and 5 star hotel. Overall: Tidy and well-maintained apartment. Location: Very convenience. Excellent service. Definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Love Yau Ma Tei”
Reviews.Author: clm03
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one month stay at Chi 279 in Yau Ma Tei. This is my second time staying at a Chi property. I stayed in a one bedroom apartment, love the furnishings and the aircon worked perfectly! It was always nice coming back to Chi 279 after a busy day. Extra special thanks to Johnny and Zoe for making me feel at home. I also love the Yau Ma Tei neighborhood, so much character!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and friendly service apartment with a twist”
Reviews.Author: FiFiYoung
Reviews.Content: My husband, nearly 2 year old son and I visited Hong Kong for first time in April. After I read other reviews, I decided to book this hotel. I'm glad I did! The room was a bit smaller than what I saw photos but it's clean, there are absolutely everything we needed, we enjoyed very comfy bed. As we have a small toddler, the kitchen and washing machine (on the roof) were so handy. Also all hotel staff were very friendly. A twist? It's located in a quite funky or i should say interesting area which my husband and I loved it. It's in the middle of shanghai street, there are so many interesting shops also close to jade market and Yau Ma Tei station. We visited other area but we prefer where we stayed! You can see the real hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good size, clean facility, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nancy C
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 1 teenager, 1 pre-teen) stayed in HK for 3 days. Trying to find a place that is not too tight for US standard, and doesn't cost you an arm and a leg - no easy task. We are very satisfied with this apartment. We got a room for 3 people and requested an additional bed. Our room has 1 double bed and a twin size bed in another room. The added bed was squeezed in between the double bed and the TV. Without the added bed, it's a very good size room for 3 people. It's a bit tight for 4 people, but we managed. The bathroom is spacious and we can store all of our luggages in a spare space in the bathroom. Staff is very friendly, contrast to most people in HK. They also speak good English. When we arrived, they knew us by names and welcomed us warmly. The security is pretty good. This is not a hotel where there is lobby area. It's a serviced apartment. So you have to ring the bell to get in. We feel very safe. The room is also very quiet. They also stored our luggages on the day we checked out until we are ready for the airport. The location is super convinient. An airport bus is just 2 blocks away. The bus runs every 10 minutes for $33 HKD each person. We took the taxi because we have 4 people. Taxi is about $220 HKD from the airport. The Yau Ma Tei MTR station (subway) was just about 5 minutes away and it has trains to all the major sites. You can get an Octopus card. You need to put in $150 in total minimum - $50 deposit and $100 to use for almost all the public transportation, including the airport bus. (Airport train is very expensive) You can add more money to the card in any of the subway stations, or in any 7/11 stores. You can also use it in many store, like McDonald, 7/11. When you return it, you will get the deposit back plus any unused balance. But they charge $HK9 if you return within 3 days, which is just a little over US$1. The famous night market "Temple Street" is just one block away. We had a lot of fun going through the night market. You can get really local food if you are brave enough. It may not look that clean, but we didn't get sick at all. Lots of shopping around. We went to the Peak at night. Beautiful. It's a must see in HK if you are there for a limited time. Take the ferry over so that you can see the HK island view at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: yrhw
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for a week in march and we couldn't praise this place enough.Perfect location within easy reach of everything including mtr.Spotlessly clean,management and staff superb and the apartment has all the amenties you will need for your holiday.The shower is powerful in a good way with plenty of hot water and the bed is like sleeping on a cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Irina01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Chi Residences 279 in February 2012 while travelling to Hong Kong from Singapore for 1 week. We were travelling with a 4 months old baby and needed a place to stay which is bigger than a hotel room. Our apartment was 1 bedroom with king size bed and quite spacious for Hong Kong standards. It was very clean and location was good - about 5 mins walking to Yau Ma Tei MTR in Kowloon. However if you take taxi to Chi, print a map in Chinese to show to driver as they don't know this location quite well. We would definitely stay in Chi Residences if we come to Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: travelliingaussie
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in hotels, so I took a gamble and stayed in an apartment for a recent short trip to Hong Kong. I would highly recommend Chi 279. The location on Shanghai street, two blocks from Nathan road and right next to the Temple Street night market really is excellent. This was my first time staying in Kowloon, and I really enjoyed it. The apartment was really well set up. Small but functional kitchen, small living area, great entertainment system, small bedroom with an extremely comfortable bed and a huge bathroom with an excellent shower. The apartment is really well decorated and is both stylish and functional. The reception staff were very friendly and happy to help with directions around the local area. I would not hesitate to recommend Chi 279 to anyone looking for a great value, well appointed and located apartment in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, great value”
Reviews.Author: Joy_loves_traveling
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very accommodating and so incredibly nice. On top of that, our apartment was 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom and then the living area and kitchen. For the location and amount we paid, the value was great. The only complaint I had was the cot was so uncomfortable that I almost wished I were sleeping on an air mattress - it would have been a lot better. The only reason I slept on the cot was because I was traveling with my parents, so it was nice the 3 of us could share that apartment. We only stayed 2 nights because they were sold out the following night, but I would definitely stay there again. The laundry that's just on the next street is very quick and cheap, which was really convenient. Would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean; read the fine print...”
Reviews.Author: mike g
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, clean hotel. Friendly staff. Free DVD's. Disappointment was the listing said a 3 room. Well one of these rooms is a bathroom, so 2 rooms, 1 with bed and tv & kitchen area all combined. We were requiring an additional bed (roll out cot). Charged an extra $200 per night, then put it at the end of our bed, between the TV and our bed. The bathroom was huge...too huge and you have to pass through the second bedroom to get to it. For three people it would have worked, as a double & single, but as our selection was for 3 beds, for 4 people, it just did not work, and I checked out after 1 night. No refunds , paid for 3 nights. The night market is right there for shopping for all kinds of useless junk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ed8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Chi for the latter part of my trip. Staff was pleasant. Elevator went out when we were leaving and they climbed the 11 floors to take our bags. Of course my bag was larger than the girl offering so I refused, but it was a nice gesture anyway. Walking distance of starbucks and the metro. The rooms were modern and large. W/D available in the building or you can walk around the corner to have it laundered for minimal fee. They even deliver back to the hotel since Chi uses them for their laundry service. Overall, pleasant stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, clean, but not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbauerguangzhou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CHI 279 for an overnight to pick up my mom at the airport. The apartment was spacious as advertised and extremely clean. It's also very well located as others have mentioned, two blocks to MTR and a McDonalds and Welcome supermarket one block away. The Temple Street Market is one short block away. In all it's a great location and a wonderful room. But it's not a hotel. No on-site restaurant, but the McDonalds is closeby for quick coffee and breakfast. As the Yau Ma Tei Metro Exit C is just a couple blocks away, transport to fancier restaurants is easy. Also, there are dozens of small restuarants all around the location and Temple Street Market has the street side table restaurants. You can get dim sum there in the evening and morning as well. Beware there is only a single bed in the room, so if you need twin beds, it could be a problem. I had noted this specifically on the reservation which they had a copy of. They wanted to charge me 200 HKD surcharge for twin beds instead of a queen. In the end it was complimentary, but the room was really geared to two people sharing a bed. They just put a roll-away in the living room. There's a couch too. So I rated the service a three star, but it's not because the service that's provided is bad. It's just there isn't really the normal kind of service you might expect in any kind of hotel setting. The desk closed at 6:00 pm the day I was there. They came back for our late arrival from the airport (I had to pick my mom up) by special arrangement, but if you were to arrive late or leave early, you need to make arrangements. The manager was very helpful and friendly though. Took our picture and helped out. You get a full kitchen, but there is zero food service on site of any kind. So you must go out as mentioned above. The ultra cleanliness of the room is really nice. Top notch. For a serviced apartment, with no hotel services, this is a great place. p.s. I didn't see a gym and clicked it by accident, however, they are close to a giant gym and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room, great for families, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: ezgoing77
Reviews.Content: we booked a 3 night stay, and we stayed in a triple room for my wife, myself plus my 2.5 yr old boy. The triple room has a queen bed plus one single bed in another "wing" type of configuration. for the price we paid, the room is huge by hong kong standards. This is more like a serviced apartment which allows daily stay, rather than a hotel, hence this might explain the difference in size. That said, don't expect hotel cosyness or decor too. This is more functional, homelike and is clean and tidy. Service is fantastic too considering we aren't thrilled about our experience with other Hong Kong service people! from the friendly office mgmt to housekeeping staff, they are smiley and helpful. toilet is a bit too big and empty (rather the space goes into the room), but is ok. toilet/kitchenette fittings are grohe, so it's good stuff even though the overall decor may not feel so. Flat screen TV is great too! Location wise, it is a short walk to Yau Ma Tei station, so it's pretty convenient. and it's just a short walk away to Temple St night market too. Actually just a block away there is already a smaller night market which is like an "extension" to the Temple St one, but on Yau Ma Tei side. My family have even walked to Mong Kok / Langham Place / Women st market area twice, not that far away. TST to our hotel is a bit further but we did that walk too, passing through Temple St along the way. One downside is that from the main entrance to the lift, there is a flight of stairs to negotiate. luggage is still ok, cos there's a small lift that is meant for wheelchairs that can take the luggage, but you need the hotel staff to activate for you I think. so for daily use, it's up and down the stairs we went with our baby stroller.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Apartment”
Reviews.Author: TimAus
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Chi Residences after travelling from Hanoi and 3 weeks into our trip. We were met by Johnny who was fantastic and was very welcoming and helpful. All the staff at this venue were extremely friendly and many places I have stayed in could learn a lot from their attitude to customer relations. Johnny showed us our apartment which was exactly what we wanted after 3 weeks of hotels. It is very well equipped with a small kitchen, a bedroom with a very comfortable bed and a nice bathroom. The lounge is equipped with a table, a lounge and an internet capable TV and sound system. On the roof there are washers and dryers that are free to use. There are also a few chairs and great views. Everything about this place was good and the prices are very reasonable when taken into context with HK accommodation costs. All the attractions are close by or very easily accessable on public transport. Plenty of night markets and great places to eat are within a short walk. When at the markets try the New Delhi Indian restaurant, very good cheap food and a great atmosphere. We would not even think of staying anywhere else in HK after our experience at Chi Residences 279.

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary in the heart of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the CHI Residences for a week on the last leg of our 7 week holiday and it was a relaxing and enjoyable experience. After a long day of sightseeing it was wonderful to come home to a wonderfully quiet, cool and spotlessly clean apartment equipped with just about everything you could need. The staff were so friendly and obliging and nothing was too much trouble for them, we were always greeted by our names and a smile! The CHI Residences 279 does not have a bar or restaurant, but that is not missed, as there are so many great eating places in the area, especially the dessert place on the corner. The area is very safe and the Residences are secure, entry is via a pass code at the front door. Close to transport, Temple Street and the Ladies Markets. One of the most comfortable beds I have slept in for ages!! We highly recommend it to travelers of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CMY_KL
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in for 2 nights. The location was central, very close to subway, right near markets / shopping action, quiet. Inside it was very safe & secure, intelligently designed, beautifully outfitted, lots of amenity and comfort, big screen tv, conveniently appointed fittings, all the comforts of home in a VERY reasonably priced apartment. It looks exactly like the web photos and staff were very helpful. Two comments for the triple room : there are only one small mirror in the toilet, and does not have any long mirrorin the room. The wash hand basin is very small, can't even put the toiletries. Overall we had a pleasant stay, and If I ever go back to HK, I'll be staying there

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay very clean with a kitchenette”
Reviews.Author: Givanchi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May 2011 for 5 days. On arrival we have to use the electronic lock but the staff appeared when we called. The access to the lift is from the 1st floor. Although there is a luggage lift to the first floor. Our check in formalities were completed very fast and we settled there. It has a small kitchen with a induction stove and basic cutlery and toaster. It wa convenient because we could have our breakfast in the place it self as it ws raining for the first 2 days. There is a btl shop and a 7 eleven and it is close to the Yau Ma Tei MRT. The ladies market is also close by. They do have a 2 washing machines and 2 dryers for use but they are located on the terrace and when it is raining we do get wet when we reach there. Plus we do not know if the machines are free or are being used by the other guests. Would definitely recomend it as the stay was very helpful and even allowed us to have a late check-out .

Reviews.Title: “Great new apartment hotel with modern furnishings”
Reviews.Author: kspace
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a comfortable place to stay which would take a triple, without too much hassle and paying for the extra bed. Knowing that the room size in HK hotels tend to be small, once you put in an extra bed there wouldn't be much place to walk about or put luggage. CHI 279 is actually a block of serviced apartments, but I think they rent out the lower floors on a daily rate. Our triple room had a partition which could be closed to separate the extra bedroom from the main room, and it was a read bed and not a foldable or sofa bed. So the bed was quite firm and comfortable. The bathroom was over-large, with a 'wasted' corner space behind the handrails. The size of the shower stall was also too big, and maybe it was intended for a bathtub but become a shower stall. There was a great contrast between the street scene outside and in the room. When the taxi first dropped us off there were some reservations, as the street was quite noisy and not so clean. But it was a world of difference once entering the hotel, and the interior renovations was marvellous. There was free internet and WiFi on the room TV, if you didn't bring your laptop along. The noise from traffic outside was minimal, even though we were on a low floor. One downside was the absence of a writing table. Its location is great, one street away from Temple St Night Market, and 5 min walk to Yau Ma Tei MTR (Exit C, Man Ming Lane). Would definitely stay here again when in Kowloon, compared to other normal hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly clean, convenient location and economical”
Reviews.Author: RashmiSharma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chi 279 in December 2010 for 2 days. The rooms are really SMALL (Guess space is a constraint everywhere in HK) but very very clean and the residence are managed by efficient and smiling staff. The location is parallel to Nathan road which is walking distance and quite close enough to MTR station as well (though we lost our way and walked to the next station !). Close to Night and Jade market and right in middle of local market with supermarkets nearby. Highly recommend to visitors for short to medium stay. We would have loved to stay more but it was fully booked hence moved to Sheraton Towers. Thank you Chi residences for a excellent and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Cyril33
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem. Out of the pricey tourist area but close to MTR. Lots of food, markets and local hangouts. Much more of a real HK experience. Rooms modern, immaculately clean. Service fantastic. a wonderful experience for our week. Free wifi a real bonus

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Best place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: NeoEvita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at CHI 279 with our 21 months old baby. We were very pleased with the apartment. Very rarely it happens that what you see on internet/website you get in reality. I would say it was rather more beautiful than the images on internet. It was neat, clean, luxurious and trendy apartment. By Hong Kong standards, we felt the apartment was quite spacious and has plenty of storage space. The apartment was equipped with high quality appliances like 37inch TV, DVD player, Ioniser and a dedicated telephone line. The wifi internet connectivity was great, also, it was free. Though kitchen had almost everything, some more utensils, cutlery etc could have been better. There was a daily maid service.. which was again a great help. on rooftop there are washing machines and dryer, again very useful. One minor grudge was that the entry to apartment lobby is not stroller friendly. Location was the best part, its located at a max 4 mins walking distance from Yau Ma Tei. There is a Wellcome supermarket at a 2 minutes walk. Nathan road is just two blocks away. Temple street market is just across the street and can be seen from the apartment. Yet the apartment was quite and peaceful. I was very much impressed with the security arrangements, there was a passkey to enter complex, electronic card to activate the elevator and door key for entry into the apartment. Door had latch and keyhole for added security comfort. They have a business centre where you can printouts for HKD 2 per page. This was very useful to us, as we use to take printouts of daily itinerary with translation in Chinese language. The staff were cordial and helpful especially Mr. Johny. We had a wonderful vacation at Hong Kong. We left with really sweet memories and CHI being one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, very clean apartments in good location”
Reviews.Author: Stuyvesant
Reviews.Content: Stayed at CHI 279 in mid-October and found it to be a clean, well-kept complex that offered value for money. Pros: cleanliness, free WiFi, proximity to night markets, good local restaurants and 2 7Eleven's within 100mtrs, easy to get taxi at front door, Nathan Rd 200mtrs away, price - HKD1000 a night, accessible roof - most guests made use of this space to relax and have drinks in the evening. Cons: taxi drivers had trouble finding the complex, apartments are very small but well designed, no lift from street level to lobby - but have a porter to carry luggage, sent several emails to the main CHI office which has still not been responded to. The location of the hotel was good - it is away from the main tourist areas which is a good and bad point. There is a guest laundry on the roof. Overall, a good apartment for the price that offered slightly more space than a hotel room.

HotelInfo.Name: CHI Residences 279
HotelInfo.Address: No.279 Shanghai Street,Yau Ma Tei, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
